instruction: Put the balls in to the holder to balance the long board on the triangular prism

query.query: How many balls can make the pivot balance?

response.reasoning: From the final image, it appears that placing all five balls into the holder balances the board against the weight of the cube on the other side.
From the final arrangement shown, placing four balls in the holder (on one side) balances the board against the green cube (on the other side).
From the weight distribution visible in the final images, placing four balls in the holder balances the board against the cube on the opposite side.
From the final scene, four of the smaller balls in the container counterbalance the green cube on the opposite side to achieve a level board.
